member.name: T:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger
member.summary: Class used to Log messages and exceptions to Windows Event Viewer, Trace Window, or MessageBox

member.name: E:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerCalled
member.summary: Fired when ErrorHandler is called. Set to Handled to true to stop MessageLogger from displaying a message box or logging to the Windows event log.

member.name: T:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerEventArg
member.summary: EventArg class for ErrorHandlerCalled event

member.name: P:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerEventArg.ThreadID
member.summary: The ID of the thread that threw the exception. (e.g. System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.ManagedThreadId)

member.name: P:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerEventArg.ThrownException
member.summary: The Exception that was thrown. It may be null if ErrorHandler was called with just a message.

member.name: P:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerEventArg.Handled
member.summary: Set to true if the error was handled. If it was handled, MessageLogger will not display a message box or log to the Windows event log.

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerEventArg.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: ID of thread to handle the event

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.OnErrorHandlerCalled(Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandlerEventArg)
member.summary: Called when ErrorHandler was called

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.Init
member.summary: Initializes the MessageLogger using info in the application's config file. Automatically called on static initialization. Gets values from Configuration file.

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.Init(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the MessageLogger using parameters; overrides values already set by Init()
member.param: Should messages be written to the Console; from MxD, this is the -DEBUG flag
Is this a Service or Wks application
A prefix to tag on to messages in the Trace window

member.summary: Initializes the MessageLogger using parameters
member.param: Name to use when logging Windows Events

A prefix to tag on to messages in the Trace window

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.WriteToTrace(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a message to the Trace window. Message will be in the form "debugViewPrefix Date functionName: msgText\nExceptionText\nCall Stack"
member.param: a function name to prepend to the message
true to include the Call Stack in the Trace window

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.WriteToTrace(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the Trace window. Message will be in the form "debugViewPrefix Date msgText"

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.WriteToTrace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a message to the Trace window. Message will be in the form "debugViewPrefix Date functionName: msgText"
member.param: name of the function where the trace was made
member.returns: the string written to the trace window

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.TraceWriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Write msg to the Trace window.

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogMessage(System.String)
member.summary: This will log a message to the Console window and Trace window

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This will log a message to the Console window and Trace window in the form "functionName: msgText"

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogEvent(System.String,System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType,System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs "functionName: msgText\nExceptionText\nCallStack" to Console window, Trace and the Windows Event Log Trace and Event log will include the stack trace

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogEvent(System.String,System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType,System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs "functionName: msgText\nExceptionText\nCallStack" to Console window, Trace and the Windows Event Log set includeStackTrace to include the stack trace in the Trace and Event log
member.param: true to include the Stack Trace in the message

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogEvent(System.String,System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType)
member.summary: Logs "functionName: msgText" to Console window, Trace and the Windows Event Log

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogEvent(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType)
member.summary: Logs msgText to Console window, Trace and the Windows Event Log as Diagnostic Event

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogEventMsg(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType)
member.summary: Logs msgText to Console window, Trace and the Windows Event Log

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogException(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs "functionName: Exception - msgText" to Console window, Trace and logs an Error to the Windows Event Log

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogException(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs "functionName: Exception - msgText\nExceptionText" to Console window, Trace and logs an Error to the Windows Event Log Does not include the stack trace

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.LogException(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs "functionName: Exception - msgText\nExceptionText\nCallStack" to Console window, Trace and logs an Error to the Windows Event Log set includeStackTrace to include the stack trace
member.param: false to rethrow the error after logging. true to just log it and not rethrow

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandler(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the app's config file has a setting for IsAService and it is a "1" just log a Windows Event. Otherwise, pop up a message box and log a Windows Event. Tacks on up to three levels of inner exceptions to the message
member.param: additional text displayed in the lower window
member.History: 12/23/2008 ABruner Modified to show MessageBox and log a Windows event for non-service apps. 3/8/2018 JGLitton added dontRethrow - unit tests were getting error in the Find task callback which caused problems

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandler(System.String,System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the app's config file has a setting for IsAService and it is a "1" just log a Windows Event. Otherwise, pop up a message box and log a Windows Event. Tacks on up to three levels of inner exceptions to the message

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandler(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If the app's config file has a setting for IsAService and it is a "1" just log a Windows Event. Otherwise, pop up a message box and log a Windows Event.
member.param: additional text displayed in the lower window

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.ErrorHandler(System.String)
member.summary: If the app's config file has a setting for IsAService and it is a "1" just log a Windows Event. Otherwise, pop up a message box and log a Windows Event.

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.GetExceptionText(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a string with inner exceptions down to 3 levels
member.param: true to include the StackTrace in the message
member.returns: a string with all the info formatted
member.History: 12/23/2008 ABruner Modified to include call stack info

members.member: Get a string with inner exceptions down to 3 levels preceded by a a statement. Optionally appends a stack trace to the returned string < exception for which to get text a statement to prepend to the exception text true to append the stack trace to the text

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.GetExceptionText(System.Exception)
member.summary: Just get a string with inner exceptions down to 3 levels

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.GetStackTrace(System.Exception)
member.summary: Get a string with the stack trace

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.WriteToConsole(System.String)
member.summary: Write msg to the console window if DEBUG is defined

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.WriteToConsole(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Write "functionName: msg" to the console window if DEBUG is defined

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.MessageLogger.WriteToConsole(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Write "functionName: msg\nExceptionText" to the console window if DEBUG is defined

member.summary: Static class used to provide debug timers - compiled only in DEBUG versions

member.summary: Starts a specified timer

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.Timing.StartTimer(System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops a specified timer. Optionally resets the timer prior to the start.

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.Timing.StopTimer(System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch,System.String)
member.summary: Stops a specified timer and prints out a time elapsed message

member.name: T:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.WindowsEventLogger
member.summary: Static class for logging a Windows Events

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.WindowsEventLogger.InitSource(System.String)
member.summary: Call to initialize the logger with the passed in Application Name

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.WindowsEventLogger.InitSource
member.summary: Called automatically when InitSource(appName) is not called. The application is assumed to be located in the "Application Name" setting of the Configuration file

member.name: M:Matrix.Utilities.Diagnostics.WindowsEventLogger.SetAppName(System.String)
member.summary: Registers the Application Name in the Windows Application Event Log. Lock is used to ensure that registration calls are not interleaved.

members.member:
Writes eventText to the Windows Event Log using MSG_DIAGNOSTIC_INFO formatting
01/04/2012 ABruner Errors occurring writing to Windows Event log (Invalid eventid value)

Writes eventText to the Windows Event Log
01/04/2013 ABruner Created

Using raiserror in a StoredProc with a severity of 0-10 causes an InfoMessage event to get fired on the SQL connection. Severity 12-19 raises an exception and is caught by a try/catch handler.
01/11/2013 ABruner Created

Using raiserror with a state > 0 indicates the message should get logged to the Windows Event Log
01/11/2013 ABruner Created
